post_text: Operation Community Spirit would like to recognize CHS Senior, Jenna Ward. To spread some cheer and entertain the kids on the street, Jenna showed her #CPSLionsPRIDE and employed her creativity to dress in homemade costume and took a walk through the neighborhood. After strolling along on her own for a few days, the kids started joining her each day in a socially distant parade on good weather days. Neighbors eventually popped out to see how she was dressed and say hello. Since quarantine began in March, she has created forty different costumes. A neighbor says “It has provided a fun, welcomed respite from the work and long days of quarantine for me, my 6 year old, and many other neighborhood children and adults. These walks were what encouraged our two neighborhood next-door besties to invent their own safe over-the-fence coloring play dates, and more.” We think Jenna is pretty special and a bright light in our community!!

post_text: Emerson House is proud to announce Shannon Walsh as Student of the Month for May. Shannon is engaged in a rigorous set of classes including Biotechnology, Calculus, Physics, Anatomy & Physiology, Senior Odyssey, Reality Check, and Accounting. Shannon is a member of the National Science and Spanish Honor Societies and is a consistent High Honor Roll Student and earned an Emerging Leader Award in her junior year. A two sport, three season athlete, Shannon has excelled into a leader in varsity field hockey. Shannon volunteers as a referee for the field hockey town league. She is also a member of the varsity girls’ lacrosse teams. Shannon is a Freshman Mentor and has volunteered countless hours to the St. Mary’s Youth Program as well as the 24-Hour Relay held yearly. She somehow finds the time to work at a local ice cream parlor too. Shannon has committed to Saint Anselm College, where she will continue her impressive field hockey career and study Biology. Congratulations! #CPSLionsPRIDE

Civics. His success in the classroom has led to his induction into the National Honor Society, Spanish Honor Society, and the Science Honor Society. He is a consistent High Honor Roll. Anthony has been a three-season sport player each year including boys’ indoor (winter) track where he was Captain this past winter. Anthony is a member of Class Reps, LIME, and Thomas Jefferson Forum. He volunteers at the Chelmsford Town Hall Book Drive and Haunt for a Cause, and others. He enjoys skiing, hiking and volleyball. He is also a summer camp counselor at Camp Tahattawan. After high school, Anthony intends to study engineering. #CPSLionsPRIDE

post_text: A message from Dr. Jay Lang regarding the closing for school for the remainder of the school year.
shared_text:
Jay Lang
April 21 at 10:46 PM ·

Good Evening Parents,

This afternoon in his daily press conference, Governor Baker announced that schools will remain closed in Massachusetts for the duration of the 2019/20 school year. We will not be returning to our school buildings for classes this year, remote learning will continue for the rest of the school year. As this decision does not surprise me, it at least provides a level of certainty with regard to our end of year schooling and helps frame the transitional work ahead.

I will work with our school leadership teams to address many of the commonly asked questions about this abrupt end to the school year in my weekly update. As I have mentioned previously, I feel very badly for our transition-year students (i.e. 4th grade to middle school, 8th grade to high school, and 12th grade to college or career). Please know we will work to make the transitions as smooth as possible and honor end-of-year activities and celebrations in some way, shape or form. More to follow.

Yours truly,

Jay Lang, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

These four enter their careers at a difficult time, but we will ensure they receive all the necessary training. They will all be undergoing field training for several weeks before beginning to patrol on their own. Welcome aboard, gentlemen!

Are you interested in learning about how public education is funded in Massachusetts, particularly in the Chelmsford Public Schools? The MA legislature recently enacted significant school funding legislation – a $ 1.5 billion Student Opportunity Act. How will this affect Chelmsford?

CPS engaged the services of Mr. Roger Hatch, retired MA DESE school finance administrator, to author a report detailing how the state funding formula (Ch. 70 aid) affects school finances in Chelmsford – historically, at the present time, and looking into the future – in light of the recently enacted legislation.

Mr. Hatch will present his analysis and report to the Chelmsford School Committee On Tuesday December 3, 2019. The regular school committee meeting begins at 6:00 p.m. Mr. Hatch’s presentation will begin at approximately 7:00 p.m. You are welcome to attend the school committee meeting or watch it live on Chelmsford Telemedia. #ChelmsfordPS #CPSLionsPRIDE

post_text: The CHS National Honor Society (NHS) officers presented a workshop at the NHS Fall MA Conference. Entitled “Bridging Borders,” their presentation focused on the walk they organized last spring to raise money for the #BeLikeBrit organization, founded to continue the vision of Britney Gengel who wanted to start an orphanage in Haiti. At the young age of 19, the Rutland MA native was tragically killed in a devastating earthquake while on a mission trip there. The initial inspiration for this project came from the Blagg family who traveled to Haiti to support the #BeLikeBrit mission this past summer. The many facets of their service project raised over $3000 for the people of Haiti. They led breakout groups with NHS officers from across the state to brainstorm future service projects for bridging global as well as local borders. Overall the day was a great success, and the students should be very proud of their efforts! #ChelmsfordPS #CPSLionsPRIDE

post_text: Thank you WCVB -TV Channel 5 meteorologist Kelly Ann Cicalese @kellyannwx who visited Center Elementary third-grade students who are learning the science of weather.
